clinical_study.brief_title: Environmental Strategies & Behavior Change to Reduce Overeating in Obese Children
clinical_study.official_title: Environmental Strategies & Behavior Change to Reduce Overeating in Obese Children

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: There is a need for effective weight control methods for obese children. Environmental strategies such as reducing the size of dishware and serving utensils, storing food out of view and reducing food consumption while watching television may reduce food intake without requiring conscious, cognitive self-control. The investigators propose to test these methods when added to a current state-of-the-art behavioral program.

detailed_description.textblock: Single blind study with outcome assessors (data collectors)and investigators masked (blinded) to intervention assignment. Analysis is intention-to-treat.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dietary intake/ meals eaten with television

arm_group.description: Six-month, family-based, group, behavioral weight control program
Six-month, family-based, group, behavioral weight control program plus home-based environmental intervention
